data.meta_description: 2001 Settling the Frontier--Land Law and Society in Peshawar Valley by Nichols s.pdf - Free ebook download as PDF File (.pdf), Text File (.txt) or read book online for free. This document provides an introduction to the book "Settling the Frontier: Land, Law, and Society in the Peshawar Valley, 1500-1900" by Robert Nichols. It discusses the Peshawar Valley's history and role as an imperial outpost. In the 16th century, Peshawar grew as a trade center and market town located at a strategic position along routes between Kabul, Persia, and Central Asia. As a Mughal garrison town, it served as a transit point for armies and trade caravans using the Khyber Pass. The imperial authorities raised revenues from local landholdings and tried to manage remote villages across the dry plains, where livestock grazed
